div1.p: United States Consulate at St Paul de Loanda

L. de R. du Verge
to Departt of State
Arrival of Henry M. Stanley & wreck of British African Mail S.S. "Ethiopia"

opener.dateline:
United States Consulate
at St Paul de Loanda S.W.C. Africa
Augt. 7th 1882.

div1.p: I have the honor to state that Mr. Henry M. Stanley arrived here on board the Belgian Steamer "Heron" from Banana, very ill on the 25th of July, and has resided since at the Netherland and German Consulate. He will leave by the Portuguese Mail steamer for Madeira, and perhaps Europe. His sickness has prevented me so far obtaining from him any information that may be of value to the State Dept.

I have also the honor to report that the loss of the British African Mail S.S. "Ethiopia" Capt Simonds, which struck on the Indian Rocks off Indian point Latt. 4" 32' South, and 11" 45' long East on the 29th of July 1882 7 a.m. The steamer was abandoned by force
to the natives by her Capt. officers and crew comprising 79. souls.

The steamer and cargo are a total loss but am told that both are well insured she had on board 2 packages addressed to this consulate which are lost; and having not received any news from the U.S. last month I am afraid that it might have been some blank forms or others sent to me by the State Dept. The Indian point, and shoal which run in a W.S.W. direction to a distance of 1 3/4 miles has at its furthermost end many sharp pointed rocks on which the "Ethiopia" was wrecked: The loss of said Steamer happening in day time, calm weather and smooth sea cannot but be attributed to gross carelessness, and rather too much trust in the part of the master to some African white traders of Loango a Trading settlement 3 miles off Indian Point passengers with him and representing themselves as thoroughly acquainted with the coast and
particularly the Indian Point and shore. The crew now here under the British Consul's care are far from behaving themselves and are daily and nightly seen drunk, and as Bilious or green fever and Dysentry are raging at present among Europeans the half of them may soon be in the hospital

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obedient servant
closer.signed:
L de R. du Verge
US Consul.
